title: How to Prepare Mary Sophia's Batter Bread from Domata Living Flour

steps.headline: Have all ingredients at room temperature.
Grease a 5” x 9” loaf pan, and dust with DLF.
Mix all the dry ingredients in your mixing bowl for several minutes while preparing the wet ingredients.
Whisk together the wet ingredients and the yeast.
Add them to the dry and mix those together for only 1 minute.
Add water, a tablespoon at a time.
steps.description: The batter should be slightly thicker than the consistency of cake batter.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter into the prepared pan.
Cover and let rise in a warm place until the dough reaches the top of the pan.
Bake for 10 minutes, then cover lightly with foil.
Bake for another 35-40 minutes depending on your oven.
Remove from the pan immediately to cool before slicing.
Store tightly covered on the counter for 3 days, in the freezer for several weeks (it will dry out in the refrigerator).

text: Have all ingredients at room temperature.  Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.  Grease a 5” x 9” loaf pan, and dust with DLF.  Mix all the dry ingredients in your mixing bowl for several minutes while preparing the wet ingredients.  Whisk together the wet ingredients and the yeast.  Add them to the dry and mix those together for only 1 minute. Do not over mix. Add water, a tablespoon at a time. The batter should be slightly thicker than the consistency of cake batter. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan.  Smooth with wet fingers.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until the dough reaches the top of the pan.  Bake for 10 minutes, then cover lightly with foil.  Bake for another 35-40 minutes depending on your oven.  Remove from the pan immediately to cool before slicing.  Store tightly covered on the counter for 3 days, in the freezer for several weeks (it will dry out in the refrigerator).
